text: [Music]
the princess with twenty skirts
this is a story from the land of Holland
of people who are called the Dutch in
Holland many many centuries ago there
lived a king and a queen who had a
beautiful daughter the princess was
lovely to look at and that she knew very
well so among all of the people of the
land who loved to look at her pretty
face she loved to look at it herself the
most in those days there were no mirrors
or medals so the princess would head
into the woods go by the lake and regale
of her gorgeous reflection in the water
[Music]
then so great was her love for nature
and the woods that she would play in the
mud all day run around with the animals
every morning and evening so that by the
time she returned to the palace her hair
would be as tangled as a bird's nest Oh
Mattia princess how am I ever to get rid
of those tangles in your hair I don't
know that it's your job please do
comment sit and let me comb your hair
this might hurt a bit Oh can't you do
anything right
you are such Ark
[Music]
and Orick
your majesty called me akin to a buffalo
that is so rude princess this waters hot
could anyone do anything right around
here as you may have noticed the
princess's behavior was nearly not as
lovely as her face playing with the
creatures of the forest and getting her
hair tangled was fine but insulting her
helpers many of them much older than her
that too when they were trying to do
their best for her was just not done the
Queen spoke of the princess's petulance
to the king the King loved his daughter
dearly and could not bear to think of
punishing her
he only assured the Queen well our
daughter is not all bad my dear she
shares my love for animals and trees and
things of the forest see how tenderly
she cares for the little calf she found
injured in the forest once and birds
flutter whenever she is out in the
garden while the King drew solace from
the princess's kindness to animals he
was worried about the kind of queen she
would make so he took the worries in his
heart and carried them to his favorite
spot in the forest the spot where his
friend the great oak had once stood it
was many many years ago when the king
was but a boy of ten he had seen some
wood cutters come to chop down the oak I
shall not let you cut this tree Prince
we need the wood then go and find a dead
tree but I shall not let you kill this
one or else drive your axe through me
before the blade touches the tree so the
wood cutters
no option but to leave the big old oak
alone the prince insisted that a Royal
Guard be placed in the forest so that no
one could cut a healthy tree and cut
wood only from already dead ones no one
was allowed to hunt any animal or catch
any bird from the forest on another day
when the young prince was playing in the
forest where is that sound coming from
sounds like an animal is in pain the
young prince searched everywhere in the
shrubs and shoots and bushes and found a
baby Oracle the ark was in terrible pain
as its leg had been hurt and the wound
was deep the king took the ORAC to the
palace and tended to it day and night
until finally it was well enough to
bound away into the woods again when the
young Prince had become older now a
youth of twenty years he had visited his
old friend the oak again to find the
poor tree dying my oak might beloved oak
what has become of you
why do you look so withered my friend I
must go fetch a doctor a gardener
whoever might know how to save you it is
of no use young prince for the time has
come for my spirit to leave this world
you'll have been kind to me and you
saved my life
on several occasions now it is time for
me to return the favor
and for me to you my dear auric you two
look so tired and worn the oak and I are
brothers we had been cursed to live as a
tree and as an animal and now the
duration of the curse is nearing its end
it is time for us to return to our land
in the stars but before we go won't
noble Prince we wish to bless your land
with untold prosperity and happiness or
your kindness surely deserves it when I
am dead take one of my horns and
fashioned a comb out of it for a
daughter you will someday have and when
I have fallen cut my bark into steaks on
your daughter turned 17 join the staves
to make a skirt for her and make her
wear it whenever she misbehaves then one
day she will find a purple flower at the
exact spot where my brother now stands
as the oak that the women of the land
spin from the stalk of the flower and
before you know it this dark forest
shall become a vibrant field full of
such flowers which your people will spin
into the finest softest fabric ever
discovered by man and your kingdom will
become one of the most prosperous ones
in the world
today so many years later as the king
stood in the wood he remembered what his
old friends the oak and the orc had said
his worried heart saw a ray of hope and
thanking them in his mind the King
rushed to the palace he had a skirt made
of the staves of the oak and a comb out
of the Horn of the Ark Oh a daughter has
once again made the governess cry with
her rudeness call her here
the princess was called for when she
arrived I hear you have been misbehaving
again enough henceforth you shall comb
your hair with this and from now on
whenever you are rude you shall wear
this no questions no discussion wear
this now and so it came to be
whenever the princess was rude or badly
behaved she was made to wear the wooden
skirt the princess did not like it at
all and her behavior soon started to
become better every time the princess
had her hair combed with the comb made
from Oryx horn the princesses manners
improved greatly I do so love the feel
of this coat it's so soft but your hair
are so tangled your majesty it might
hurt yes right don't worry dear
governess I shall be very still
are you alright oh I'm sorry so very
very sorry your majesty
as long as you are okay it is fine don't
worry anyone can slip like that everyone
was amazed at the wonderful change that
had come over the once arrogant rude and
selfish princess soon her manners were
as beautiful as her face she no longer
needed to wear the wooden skirt and was
the kindest sweetest person in the
kingdom one day as she went into the
woods as usual she reached the spot
where the old oak had once been and she
saw the prettiest daintiest flower there
ever was she took the flower to the
palace and showed it to her mother and
her aunt who had come visiting was found
in the forest today
what a strange beautiful flower that is
no ordinary flower dear this is flax
flax what is that soon
the aunt shows the ladies in the palace
how to roast the stalk and extract the
flax from the flower and spin it into
soft beautiful linen
before long the entire forest had become
a huge field of the flax flowers and
everyone in the kingdom was spinning the
flax into soft linen the tailor's made
wonderful shirts for the men and skirts
for the ladies the princess loved the
linen so much that one day
the skirt feels sooo soft bring another
look at the flower keeps me bring me one
move boil up the more good as it looks
get me one bowl the princess wore 20
skirts in all and walked with such elan
in the palace that all the ladies
thought that 20 skirts was the number of
those beautiful skirts to wear the
fashion spread all around the kingdom
and every girl every woman and every
bride had to have 20 skirts around her
and to this day the fashion which the
princess had begun stays in the land of
Holland among the Dutch people the
fashion that was brought by the princess
who wore 20 skirts more importantly we
must note that this was the same
princess who had to wear a skirt made
out of wood and now she could wear soft
linen that felt comfortable even when
twenty skirts were wrapped around her
when we are willing to accept our faults
and work on them we become light-hearted
and joyful then people feel comfortable
around us and celebrate whatever we do
once the princess became polite and
loving nobody talked of her rudeness
anymore because when we ourselves give
up our bad habits others naturally
forgive us that is the true way of the
world
[Music]
